pack

Class EventController

  • java.lang.Object
    • pack.EventController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<javafx.concurrent.Worker.State>

    public class EventController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<javafx.concurrent.Worker.State>
    Controller for all actions that the browser can take. Handles e.g. going back/forward in history, entering of new webpage showing/hiding the history pane etc.
    Author:
    anton

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  EventController.ExceptionChangeListener
      ExceptionChangeListener for invalid URLs and Connectivity Displays error to user if exceptions register during page loading

    • Method Detail

      • loadWebpage

        private void loadWebpage(java.lang.String newPage)
        Load a new webpage into the WebView
        Parameters:
        newPage - the page URL to be loaded

      • loadPreviousWebpage

        private void loadPreviousWebpage()
        Go back one page in the WebHistory. If no history is present, it does nothing.

      • loadForwardWebpage

        private void loadForwardWebpage()
        Go forward one page in the WebHistory. If there is no forward page, it does nothing.

      • updateFBButtons

        private void updateFBButtons()
        Update the Back and Forward buttons Buttons are only active if there exists a forward/backward page to go to, otherwise, they are disabled.

      • toggleHistory

        private void toggleHistory()
        Toogles the visibility of the history pane

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        ActionListener for the addressfield, back/forward buttons and the history button. Makes sure that their onClick actions are correctly handled.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • changed

        public void changed(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<? extends javafx.concurrent.Worker.State> observable,
                    javafx.concurrent.Worker.State oldValue,
                    javafx.concurrent.Worker.State newValue)
        WebView.LoadWorker StateChangeListener If Worker.STATE == SCHEDULED, then the progressbar is initiated. If Worker.STATE == SUCCEDED, then the progressbar is disabled, and the text of the address bar is set to the current page.
        Specified by:
        changed in interface javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<javafx.concurrent.Worker.State>
